thread.title: Gossip & Rumours: Diego costa reaches £30million-a-year pre-agreement move to China
thread.title_full: Gossip & Rumours: Diego costa reaches £30million-a-year pre-agreement move to China

title: Gossip & Rumours: Diego costa reaches £30million-a-year pre-agreement move to China
text:
Chelsea's Diego Costa celebrates with teammates after scoring during the English Premier League soccer match between Chelsea and Hull City at Stamford Bridge stadium in London, Sunday, Jan. 22, 2017. (AP Photo/Frank Augstein) 
Diego costa has reached a £30million-a-year pre-agreement to move to China in the summer, according to reports. 
A Spanish journalist Manu Carreño revealed the news on his radio show The Rail that Costa’s move is “total” and “absolute”. 
The striker wanted to move in January transfer window but was blocked by the Blues. 
Chinese side Tianjin Quanjian offered over £70million for the striker but Antonio Conte did not want him to leave as they fight for the Premier League title. 
But, according to the reports, Costa will be allowed to exit in the summer and become one of the highest paid players in the world.
